Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: sweetiebabe05
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera only because buying a new memory card and an extra battery for my Sony Cybershot that I've had for 4 years was going to be almost as much as buying a brand new camera so I opted to just get a new camera. Oh em gee...am I glad I did. I love this camera. It has everything I've ever wanted in a camera and more. The touch screen is so nice its like using my iPhone only with better quality pictures. All the different modes such as retro colors and old time photos and sepia along with classic black and white are also included. You can edit your photos right on the camera and crop out or colorize anything you want and add borders and text and even tag people for easy upload to Facebook. Basically its like photo editing right on your camera.I had a really old Kodak Easyshare when they first came out. It was clunky and silver and one of the first digital cameras to come out as as a point and shoot. That thing is probably close to 10 years old and it will not die. Its been dropped, beaten, wet, hot, cold, everything and it still hasn't quit working so I'm hoping for the same durability in my new camera but of course I hope I don't drop it anytime soon.As some people on forums have complained of course the directions aren't "complete" obviously its 2011 and most companies expect you to have some working knowledge of how to use a camera by now.My only complaint is that the battery has to be in the camera and the camera plugged in to charge the battery which is aggravating if you want to be able to charge a battery while using the camera. The usually the point of buying an extra battery is it not? So for that its kind of annoying maybe I'll find an adapter somewhere but for now I am extremely happy with the new camera. Not to mention its totally cute.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Camera for me!
Reviews.Author: 911Kaitlin "Little Ham"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera on Amazon, of course because it was cheaper. I used to have a Panasonic camera that I purchased around the Thanksgiving sale 2010 for $88. I thought it was a great deal, but it has only lasted me this long. It was time for a new camera.I take hundreds of pictures at a time - I have a 1yr old son that I enjoy taking pictures of. When the pictures were getting fuzzy, I decided it was time to invest in a new camera. I did lots of reserach, and I decided on this Kodak Touch Camera. I am so happy with it so far. As I added in the attributes above, I give the picture quality 5 stars. They are so clear and crisp. Sometimes I take a picture and my hand will shake, and the picture still comes out perfectly clear. I love it for that aspect.Initally using the camera, the internal memory only held 4 pictures. I completely forgot to order a memory card to go along with it. I ended up ordering a 8GB memory card, and now the camera holds 1700 pictures, and 30 mintues of video! Speaking of video, it takes great videos! The camrea picks up the right volume and great picture. You can keep going consecutively with the video - some other camera's I've had only allow 2 or 3 minutes at a time, then you have to start all over again. The pictures up-load to the computer very fast. You can use the Facebook app to directly upload them to your accout. Also, mine automatically uploads to my snapfish account which is nice too. Overall, this camera is 4 stars to me -- I definately recommend it.There are just a few flaws: Another attribute I added with only 3 stars was the Performace Speed of the camera. When you take a picture, and it shows you what it looks like, it takes a very long time for it to clear off of the screen. I'm not sure if there is any way to get past looking at it for so long, but I've tried a few different buttons to speed it up and it doesn't work. Also, it is very slow when you try to delete a picture right away after taking it. You press the garbage can symbol, and then "yes" that you would like to delete it. It takes approx 7 seconds to clear off of the screen. That may not seem like a long time thinking about it, but when you are sitting there with a picture perfect moment, and it is taking so long to clear, you will get frustrated too. My way around that; if you are taking mulitple pictures, and you have a bad one... wait until you up-load them on your computer, delete it then, not on the actual camera. I will edit if I have any further comments/ and knock on wood any problems!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Lilly Nelson
Reviews.Content: I have only had this camera for 1 day, but so far I love it. It was super easy to set up, and all the required software is right in the camera memory (no CDs to deal with!) It takes MUCH clearer pictures than my old camera (a Casio Exilim, which, admittedly, sucked!)  I take a lot of pictures of my active toddler and so far all my photos have turned out nice and clear.  I also take photos for my Etsy store, and the photos with this camera (and the right lighting) are much brighter and clearer straight from the camera, so require less editing.I like the touch screen, it's a little frustrating sometimes if you have "fat fingers" and want to change a setting quickly.  But should be pretty easy to get used to, and it's definitely more intuitive than a button interface.I haven't used many of the "fancy" settings yet but I will update my review later once I've tried them out.Overall, I am very happy with my purchase and look forward to using this camera for a long time.Edit: February 12, 2013 - After over a year and a half I still love this camera and it's still going strong!  I was afraid the touchscreen would not hold up well over time, especially with small children around, but it is still working great.  I also have taken a ton of videos of my kids with this camera and actually ended up getting rid of our "real" video camera because it was just so much easier to grab this one instead, and the video quality is just fine.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!!!!
Reviews.Author: eyelashes
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous to buy this camera after reading a couple bad reviews, but I'm so glad I bought it! It has the coolest features and editing options I've ever seen! The touch screen is very responsive and easy to use. I haven't even looked at the manual yet and I don't think I will need to. This is the best camera I've ever had and I definately reccommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: Second Kodak
Reviews.Author: Joanne M.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera after having a 5MP Kodak which I was very happy with for several years and was disappointed with the new Kodak.  Let me first say that the picture quality is very good on this little camera in both day and night shots, however the fuctionality leaves much to be desired.  The touch screen is just OK, You have to hook up the camera to the USB cable then plug the USB cable into an A/C adapter to charge the camera, a real pain.  You cannot put a date stamp on the pictures when you take the shot, you have to first take your pics then go into review/edit mode and individually select the pics you want to date stamp and the camera goes through each pic seperatly and adds the stamp.  A real time waster and battery waster, and if you are like me that love the date stamp, especially if you take a lot of shots of your kids this becomes simply unacceptable.  My camera also froze up on several occasions and the only way to unfreeze it was to remove the battery and reinsert it.  So needless to say the camera went back and I went with a Canon instead.

Reviews.Title: I love this thing
Reviews.Author: SaxGoddess
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera specifically for a last-minute road trip.  I also have a larger Sony HandyCam, but I didn't want to have to fly with it since it takes up so much room.  I have to say I was very impressed with the capabilities of this little thing.  The touch-screen at this price level was a really nice (unanticipated) feature.  Plugging the camera into your computer was a snap and all my pics were downloaded automatically.  It was pretty foolproof.  While I did have some trouble getting the right light in some bright indoor settings (museum), overall this is a pretty perfect little point-and-shoot for someone who doesn't want things to be overly complicated.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Tenswim
Reviews.Content: This touch screen camera takes excellent pictures.  The images are very sharp and the color well balanced. The different scene modes are very effective in producing the desired results.  The camera is easy to navigate.  The LCD is very bright and slideshows look great.  You can pull up pictures by people's names, tag words, etc. Reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: Avoid this product like the plague
Reviews.Author: Ash
Reviews.Content: I have had a terrible time with my Kodak easyshare touch M577. It has been nothing but trouble from the beginning. It is slow to process things, to the extent that often when you're trying to take a picture, the moment has passed before the camera is ready. The camera also freezes, and the only way to fix it is to take out and reinsert the battery. The EasyShare software is the only way to transfer photos from the camera to the computer (you can't just use the Windows camera wizard or do things manually through My Computer), and never was a piece of software worse named: it is the LEAST easy piece of software to use! I have also had problems with the camera freezing when it is connected to the computer, which means that although I can take pictures, I can't do anything with them once they're taken, because I can't upload them from the camera to the computer. The customer service on the Kodak website is terrible; it always ends up telling you to check the owner's manual (which doesn't have the answers), and when you try to use chat or email, either no one is available to help, or the scripts on the page don't function correctly. I wish I had realized all this earlier; I would have returned the product and bought one from a different company. DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Very handy camera
Reviews.Author: Evelyn Felice
Reviews.Content: I like Kodak cameras! As a strictly casual user, I find this camera easy to use, has a large screen, the latest touch controls and can easily fulfill point and shoot use without too much fiddling.  For older ladies like me and for beginners, this is a very useful and practical camera.

Reviews.Title: Kodak M577
Reviews.Author: Patty
Reviews.Content: I really like the Kodak M577 touch.. Took a little to learn and still leaning but it works great for pictures. The video don't turn out to good on my computer but it may be my computer is too slow? The only thing I don't like is the micro SDHC card. It is so small, wish it used a regular size SD card. Would be so much easier......At Amazon the price was right!

Reviews.Title: Freezes up
Reviews.Author: T Luke
Reviews.Content: I loved the camera, took clear, excellent pictures.  The LCD screen resolution is bright and beautiful.  BUT...the camera would freeze up often and I would have to remove the battery to get it working again which was a pain.  I returned back to amazon for a refund.  I now have the Kodak Easyshare Touch M5370 16 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom, HD Video Capture and 3.0-Inch Capacitive Touchscreen LCD (Blue) which is a smaller upgraded version of this one.  The LCD screen is not as cool but no problems as of yet!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera!
Reviews.Author: California
Reviews.Content: This recently introduced Kodak Easyshare Touch M577 camera is a real gem.  Easy to program, it's instant on/instant off and easy to use. The LCD touch screen is crisp, bright, and Ipad like - pictures are reviewed with the simple flick of a finger. Battery life in screen saver mode is excellent.  Photo review on the LCD screen is a snap.  In smart capture mode, the 28 mm German SCHNEIDER-KREUZNACH VARIOGON wide-angle lens produces crisp daytime and even night photographs - all without flash while capturing brilliantly vivid colors.  Images are crisp and sharp. A host of special film effects are offered.  All this in a lightweight 5.3 oz package that easily fits in the shirt pocket.  A nice feature - battery charging is easy through the micro USB port, which enables "in-camera" charging, so need to remove the battery; simply plug into any wall socket or even the USB port on your computer (the latter requires an optional USB to microUSB cord); either will charge. It seamlessly synchronizes and uploads photographs to our PC, again via the micro USB port.  Not your usual point-and-shoot, this is a great value.Great things sometimes do come in small packages.  This is one of them!  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: VERY GREAT CAMERA FOR THE PRICE!
Reviews.Author: Miguel Zaera
Reviews.Content: I own this camera for over 3 months and is excellent, very good quality and impact resistant than maybe other cameras do not resist, the image is very clear and precise with very good quality HD videos. Good design, good price, good quality and nice features. I LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: NICE!!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: This is nice, not heavy plus you can send pictures to anybodys email. I highly recommend this camera plus the pictures comes out good!!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Doctor J
Reviews.Content: This Camera is pretty awesome, it has a very responsive touch screen, and shoots pretty clear images. It doesn't have very many features beyond the basics, but for it's unbeatable price, I would say it's worth the purchase.

Reviews.Title: I loved this camera...
Reviews.Author: Gigi "Horse Lover"
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera for the first few months. It worked very well, took good pictures, and generally went everywhere with me. I started having problems with it months ago, and had to replace the battery after only about 4 months of use. I got it fixed, buying a whole new battery, and within days the camera broke and would not charge. Many people seem to have this same problem, so I know my camera is not just a dud. The website was terrible if you are looking for ways to solve problems with the camera; they didn't even have the answers to my questions half the time. However, this IS  good camera, especially for first-timers since it is very easy to figure out without a whole lot of buttons.

Reviews.Title: do not fear the touch screen- very user friendly
Reviews.Author: K. Forttrell "soccer monster"
Reviews.Content: I do not own a smart phone or anything touch screen (although my husband & virtually everyone I know does so I am familiar with them) and I found this camera very easy to navigate. This took GREAT pics and video- crisp & clear- and i highly recommend it for its price range. I used to own a canon power shot that cost 2x as much and was very difficult to navigate. It went swimming last year and I'm glad it did because now i have this little gem. The "red/orange" color looks pretty darn orange to me, but that's what i was hoping for. another thing to note is the camera uses a micro SD card (not included), not a regular SD. Internal memory held maybe 20 pics. battery is charged by either a USB cord solely OR the USB cord with wall adapter (both included).

Reviews.Title: Love it..
Reviews.Author: Alexis
Reviews.Content: I have had other cameras such as HP, but I love this camera.. I love the color and clarity of the pictures. However I do not understand the share feat.It never work when I try to use it. If this was improved then I would have rated this 5 stars..

Reviews.Title: Easiest camera ever!
Reviews.Author: Cramden
Reviews.Content: I've only had it for a few weeks, so I haven't put it to the test. However I have taken several pictures with it, and they come out beautifully! I recommend this camera to anyone who doesn't want to be loaded down with a bunch of camera equipment, but wants GREAT pictures to show family and friends.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing
Reviews.Author: Gatz
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera after seeing overall high marks by Amazon reviewers. When it was in transit to my address I saw this M577 model on clearance at Target for $75 but I figured this model was being replaced by Kodak. The camera was disappointing from the start no matter how much I adjusted it's settings for specific photographic conditions. It just performed no better than a disposable 35mm camera. My friend has a 10mp 4x optical zoom Canon point and shoot that is several years old and does not know anything about ISO or EV settings yet his photographs from bright daylight to sunsets to stars at night were all sharp and without noise. The M577 actually took it's best photographs in Smart Capture mode with sufficient or outdoor lighting but there was to much flash indoors where a higher ISO capability would have been preferable.I returned mine and would strongly advise against buying this camera unless you just want something to take acceptable (though noticeably blurry and over/underexposed) photographs. For a little over $100 more I am getting the very highly rated Nikon P300 which even has several video capturing modes including full HD (1080p) and 120fps for slow motion playback.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Kitty "Kitty"
Reviews.Content: I like it very much.  However, in sunlight it's hard to see the subject on the screen.  Have to simultaneously hold the camera, try to shade the screen and make any adjustments needed, hold it steady and then push the button without moving the camera.

Reviews.Title: Easyshare touch
Reviews.Author: T. Reed "Moonglow"
Reviews.Content: Camera seems to work great. Great price for value. Used for personal photos. Some learning curve for how to utilize the share feature with facebook/emails. Good compact size, great resolution. Too bad Kodak is going out of the camera biz. I would purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Bill1451
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my wife. She loves it. Compact and very easy to use. Takes great pictures.We are very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: I researched many different cameras before choosing this camera. I love how easy it is to operate, change settings flash etc and download the pictures to my computer. I also think Amazon had an amazing pice plus the free shipping compared to any other website I checked.

Reviews.Title: great little camera, works great and slim design in perfect
Reviews.Author: bearhamel
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Sleek design makes it easy to carry in purse or jacket. Takes great pictures! Photo share capabilities a plus!

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Touch M577 14 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: lifetimeman1
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 14 year old son who wanted it for touch screen feature and color.  It takes great pictures also.  I'm planning on buying another one for my wife this Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: LOBSTER
Reviews.Content: Completly happy with this camera touchscreen is exelent results of photo quality outstanding I have used many high end cameras'over the years and this point and shoot compact is as good as any of them and fits easy in your pocket for the spur of the moment shots.more than worth the money .

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: KNI "KNI"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It is small enough to carry in my purse and it makes great pictures.  I have a larger camera that makes excellent pictures but I wanted one I could carry on trips and on our boat.  The only problem I have with it is holding it steady.  It is not that hard but I tend to snap a picutre and forget to be still.

Reviews.Title: Was a present for my GF.
Reviews.Author: Hans Woesthoff "batavier"
Reviews.Content: The Schneider (GLASS) lens makes excellent pictures. This camera is easy enough to use by a non-photographer. Yet produces very competent pictures

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: cora mackensen
Reviews.Content: i really love it.  so easy to use. can't wait for the holidays to really capture fun. always have it with me like my cell

Reviews.Title: Perfect gift
Reviews.Author: tigger43544
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my husband.  He absolutely loved it.  He uses it almost every day and what's cool about it is that you can send pics through email, facebook or twitter and the screen in touch screen.  I highly recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Easy, fast, simple, clear bright pictures
Reviews.Author: Adrea E. Sherman "AdreaE"
Reviews.Content: Works super easy, turns on/off real fast, love that it comes in different colors, love that it has unique settings and am able to play around with my pictures a little bit without having to load them on my pc 1st, just had to pay extra for a roomy memory card but I think this little basic easy to use camera is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted.
Reviews.Author: Garvin E. March
Reviews.Content: Great size, all the features we wanted and needed.  Love the color, the quality of the pictures and the ease of the download to the PC..

Reviews.Title: changed my mind when it died shortly after I bought it
Reviews.Author: M. Hancock
Reviews.Content: I gave this a great review -- but I'm changing it.  It locked up -- the lens won't retract and taking the battery out does not help.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: LRBB from CRC
Reviews.Content: I had an identical camera until one day I lost it. I loved image quality and ease of the touch screen. Luckily I found it much cheaper than I had paid for it before. It works very fine.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Biztrades
Reviews.Content: I'll recommend this product to anyone, My advise to those buying expensive gear is "Stop showing off" an grow up. No one cares what you use and how much you spent on it...the bottom line is quality!

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Naomie Christensen
Reviews.Content: There are already some problems. It is older and some functions are not working too well. It still works though. It just has some problems on the zoom and I don't like having to take the memory out. I think kodak stopped offering the software so it is plug and play. That's not the sellers fault, but eh.

Reviews.Title: KODAK EASY SHARE
Reviews.Author: JOANN M MC KENNA
Reviews.Content: GOOD PRODUCT HAPPY WITH IT/GAVE IT AS A GIFTTO MY SON & HIS WIFE TO BE.THEY SAID THEY WERE HAPPY WITH IT

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Keslie10
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a simple point and shoot camera and I was very impressed with the quality of the images. It has unbelievable focusing capabilities that are utilized in standard mode. It is very easy to get extremely crisp and clean photos. The battery is long lasting and very easy to charge. I love the sharing capabilities, it is very easy to share to facebook, youtube and other social media. The only complaint I could contest to is the lack of responsiveness from the touch screen. It does a good job reading the touch, but sometimes it does lag. The touch capabilities are not the same as modern day smart phones. Other than that, I would say it's an excellent camera for everyday use. I love mine and I've had it for over a year and a half and still works like it is brand new!

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: mary lemon
Reviews.Content: It does way more than I need. Ilove it. I cnat belive all the things i can do with it. WAY COOL

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Sterlin
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I thought this would make a great gift for my niece. She's 18 and loved it even though she has an iPhone still plent of times when a camera is better

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Ronda
Reviews.Content: I have this camera in black and mom saw it, loved it, and requested one for Christmas.  Hers is purple and she was thrilled to open it on Christmas Day!  It's easy to use and the sharpness of the photos is great!The seller was awesome...VERY responsive and kept me apprised of the shipping status, etc.  GREAT experience!Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Curtis
Reviews.Content: I really have no issues with this camera.  It takes great photo's and video.  I really like the touch screen.

Reviews.Title: Kadak easy share touch M577
Reviews.Author: Sylvia Santiago
Reviews.Content: I seems hard for me to learn, and be comfortable with using it. It needs an adapter to print the photos. Looks nice, and is light weight, to carry.

Reviews.Title: Kodak M577
Reviews.Author: john dromazos
Reviews.Content: I wanted to have an easy to handle camera. Also the name Kodak was essential for me. The quality of the pictures is superb. It took some getting use to in using the micro SD card.

Reviews.Title: Easy to operate camera
Reviews.Author: Leslie Kilgore
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my granddaughter because it is easy to use and a good starter camera. I only gave it 4stars because I read that Kodak is not going to make cameras any more.

Reviews.Title: Kodak makes the best point & shoot cameras hands down
Reviews.Author: IA_Mom_of_2
Reviews.Content: My last 3 cameras have all been Kodaks, and I was heartbroken when I heard they're getting out of the digital point & shoot game.  They are easy to use, reasonably priced, take good quality photos & videos, and can take a beating.  We were a little curious as to how this one would work having the touch screen because my husband has big hands, but he has no problems with it because the buttons are decent-sized and responsive.  The only SLIGHTLY negative thing I can say is the review time after taking a pic is a bit long and there's no way to turn it off - BUT you can 'dismiss' it quickly by tapping the shutter button, so at least there's a workaround.Nice little camera and a good price.  Couple it with the Square Trade Accident Protection and you absolutely can't go wrong!!

Reviews.Title: Is very good price and good quality
Reviews.Author: Paula e Lopez.
Reviews.Content: I love the digital camara  and the price is very good  the quality is very good and I love it because is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Waspass
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd one of these Camera that I've bought... the first I bought for myself in the orange color and everyone loved it.  I love the ease of use.  the size is great ..... not too bulky.... it's smaller than my cell phone... and takes Great Pictures.... This one I bought to give as a Christmas Gift....

Reviews.Title: Grandparents loved it...
Reviews.Author: Marcus E. "Marcus-Eli"
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas present for the grandparents and seeing as they already owned a super outdated Kodak camera this was a no brainier. You know how older people are, the stick to a brand swear by it. Grandma was happy to just see the box, grandpa was a totally different story. Lol, he wanted to see the features, how many Mp's did it have, the works. This from a man with a 5mp camera! Lol! He was funny, acting like he knew what the features were looking at it with his "reading glasses". As soon as I told him about the one touch movie button for taping the babies, he was interested. When I said it was 14mp and a touchscreen, he was impressed. The icing on the cake, the added 8gb memory card that I bought with the camera, I can do no wrong for the next 6 months :)The camera takes beautiful pictures. In a dark room the flash will light up the subject but not the background so much. It took a little time to get used to the movie button, kept hitting it by mistake, it's right next to the shutter button. I've never been a fan of having a touchscreen on a camera (thats my preference), but the grandparents love it. They both still have flip phones so this was a real step up.

Reviews.Title: very good for the price
Reviews.Author: risris1234
Reviews.Content: Nice and compact camera. Touch screen works very smoothly and pictures are nice wether taken  day or night. Plus the price is very good.

Reviews.Title: M577...AWESOME EASY SHARE
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: I was so delighted when I was still able to buy another Kodak camera. Unfortunately they seem to slip out of my hand and break before I put the wrist strap on but I am always eager to buy another!!  I always love Kodak easy share. I  was freaked out when I thought they were no longer for sale but was trilled to purchase on Amazon. This touch screen model M577 is AWESOME. I never had so much fun playing with my picures and adding caption and frames and the highlighting colors. I LOVE THIS CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: Janice
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the low price. It is exactly what I have been looking for! Very easy to use,and I love the touch screen.

Reviews.Title: Best One Yet
Reviews.Author: Boiler
Reviews.Content: It's too bad Kodak exited the digital camera business, I've had several of them, and was very pleased with all.  I needed to replace my M863 which I dropped too many times, and am very happy with the M577.  This is the best inexpensive pocket digital they've made.  The touch screen is well featured and intuitive.  Focusing, shutter lag and time to next picture is very fast.  Love this camera!  If you would like an inexpensive pocket camera that takes super photos, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: Kodak M577 Easy Touch Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: dtd655
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my birthday and also because I like the Kodak brand.  I'm disappointed that Kodak is going out of the digital camera business; however, I decided that if and when this camera bites the dust, I'll simply trash it and buy something else.  The M577 is one of the easiest cameras I've ever used and, so far, I have no complaints in that department.  Because of past problems with Kodak software, I was leery about this camera.  The software couldn't be simpler (it loads from the camera to the computer) and your photos can be transferred directly to  your computer or social network (i.e. Facebook or You Tube among others.)  I got a great deal from Amazon.  Many thanks!!

Reviews.Title: super buy
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. I'm still learning all the features but it is so easy to use,. I love how the pictures come out. Great color and clarity to the pictures and I'm not the best picture taker. would recommend the camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product by Kodak
Reviews.Author: Andy L. Scott
Reviews.Content: easy to useclear and beautiful photoseasy to edit and intuitive functionalitythanks Kodak for another fine photographic product

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Cristen "Epic"
Reviews.Content: Just received the other day. Could not believe the quality of the extreme low light shots with auto flash on.Absolutely simple and fun to use right out of the box.  Very short charge time. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great price, great product
Reviews.Author: PunkRockRebel
Reviews.Content: I'm quite proud of my purchase. I got it at a good price and it's a good quality camera. It has so many features and it's touch screen! There is a setting for just about every situation as well as custom settings. It's sleek, works great, good-lookin, and well-priced.

Reviews.Title: Loved, lost and reordering
Reviews.Author: bruja00001
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera, took all my Christmas photos, they were wonderful memories,and then on the trip home lost in either Gulfport, MS, or Dallas TX airport.SICK, that memories are gone, and sick that lost that great camera.  It is soeasy to use, no red eye, sharp and clear.So I am ordering another one.  The RedOrange color is the best.

Reviews.Title: A good car dashboard video accident recorder
Reviews.Author: Q "aaa16848"
Reviews.Content: I got my Kodak Easy Share Touch M577 from OfficeMax $59.99 + tax + free shipping one week ago.I used Canon PowerShot SD870IS as a car dashboard video accident recorder. The problem was that I had to unscrew the camera from the Friction mount and took out the battery whenever I need to charge the battery, usually each other day. So I was looking for a cheap camera to replace the Canon and this camera meets my requirement: wind angle, HD video and charging battery in camera by USB cable with home or car charger. Also can be charged by connect to a computer.Put an 8 GB micro SD card in, fully charge the battery and turn it on. I Immediately noticed that the camera shows I can take 29 min video. I replaced the 8 GB card with the Transcend 32 GB class 4 card. It still shows can take only 29 min video. I charted with Kodak tech support. The tech did not have any idea and just told me to format the card. After format the 32 Gb card (it only took few seconds). It still shows can take only 29 min video. I just gave a try. After 29 min recording, the camera stopped automatically and showed the message "for HD video only allow 29 min video..." Now I understand why it shows 29 min in HD video mode. 29 min video occupies 1.7 GB memory space. A fully charge battery can last for 84 min video recording and it is enough to cover my daily commute.I wish it can record while it is charging that take off one star.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare camera
Reviews.Author: harley
Reviews.Content: We're very happy with this camera, takes nice pictures and is easy to use.  We looked a while before we decided on this one and are pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Walter
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera Super easy to use with the touch screen like using a smart phone . The picture quality is great If you looking for a camera this is a good buy

Reviews.Title: Affordable quality
Reviews.Author: Maverick
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it was the only one in the price range I was looking for that had both a large screen and a touch screen. I wasn't even looking to get 14MP, that was just a bonus.  In order to get these options in Canon or Nikon (both brands I like very much, but tend to be pricier) you would have to spend upwards of $250-$300.  I am kind of hard on cameras so I didn't want to invest quite that much.  This was everything I could have asked for.  The picture quality is great, the touch screen works well and the controls are pretty easy to figure out. All in all, I am very happy with my purchase, and didn't have to shell out an arm and a leg to get the features I wanted.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Touch M577
Reviews.Author: Mary G. Crews
Reviews.Content: I am new to touch screen technology.I found the Kodak M577 easier than  expected to operate. The price was good and it included a mini sd card! The orange color was awesome,too!

Reviews.Title: Cute lil camera
Reviews.Author: J. Goerge "Small_Town_Girl"
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my 11 year old daughter. She is thrilled with it. Very easy to use. Love the touch screen. She takes photos and videos constantly. Haven't had any photos printed yet but the shot looks great on the playback. Extremely happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: I love everything about this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: cthawkins04
Reviews.Content: This camera is great....I'm kicking myself cause i didn't look at this one first!!! While i haven't had time to use it as often as i did my old camera i can still tell it is sooo much better!!! Great buy!!! Great quality for the price!

Reviews.Title: Great photos!
Reviews.Author: Aunt Cindy "Sara"
Reviews.Content: Great camera for a small price! Love the touch feature, and the photos are great. Movies too! So happy with it I bought one just like it for my daughter, whose very expensive camera wasn't putting out the quality pictures my camera was.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera I have owned
Reviews.Author: Tara
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kodak camera and I was very pleased with my first two, but this one is awful.  When I take my first picture, I don't have a problem, but I have 3 young kids and need to snap a lot of pics to try to get one where everyone is looking at the camera.  This camera keeps freezing after I take the first picture.  There is a very long pause - sometimes up to 30 seconds long before the camera will take the next picture - it's awful!  I definitely would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Enid Price
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera that slips right into my front pocket. Takes great photos and videos. Even the the Smart Capture feature takes close up photos perfectly, so I don't have to choose the close-up setting when I'm taking photos of flowers, etc. I like that it has a separate button for photos and videos. Makes taking videos on the fly much faster. It's too slow to delete a bad photo right after taking it, so I just have to delete later when I'm not in the middle of an event. Also, I wish it wasn't so slick. I'm afraid it's going to slip out of my hand. But for a little camera, it's great.

Reviews.Title: Camera freezes and touch screen is not very friendly
Reviews.Author: skatta
Reviews.Content: I brought this camera for the big lcd display and nice features, however was disappointed because1. It does not come with a memory card so you have buy one (luckily I found 32GB on amazon for $25)2. You cannot charge the battery by itself, you have to charge while the battery is inside the camera.3. Worst one!!! The camera freezes all the time and the only way to resolve it is to remove the battery and restart it. that really sucks and I have never this problem with my other camera's (Canon, Fuji, Sony)4. The touchscreen is not friendly. Once you click delete picture it takes few seconds .There are good things too about this camera but the cons overpower the pros1. The picture quality is good.2. The share feature is useful3. Face recognition is good.

Reviews.Title: kodak camera nuff said.
Reviews.Author: Karlee
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera. I had a kodak easy share camera that is way old. It is only 6 mega pixelsI love my new camera. its very easy to use and share photos. I love that its rechargeble and you don't have to worry about replacing the batteries.I took my camera to the festival of colors with my family and the pictures turned out great! (this was the first time i used my camera) it was a blast!!!The only thing i dislike about this camera is the kodak logo is raised up so you can feel the letters, this doesn't make for a comfortable hold I think.^ that is the only thing i'd change about this camera!

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera but no Date Stamp default feature? failed 14 months
Reviews.Author: Troy C "tcbengals"
Reviews.Content: So far, camera is fine, takes a little to get used to navigating the touch screen and the icons, but working ok.  Big downfall is that you can only set the date stamp after you take pictures and have to apply to each individual picture, so it is a big time consumer if you take a lot of pictures and want the date on them.  I contacted Kodak and there is no global settings to put a date stamp on you pictures prior to taking them? This may not be an issue for some users. So now updating original review, after 14 months, my camera is useless, can not turn it on, did all the troubleshooting, no luck, and like other reviews I could not transfer pictures from camera to my new laptop, I had to transfer them to my old laptop, put on flash drive and transfer to new laptop, firmware never recognized on new laptop, frustrating, going to buy new again and not Kodak, I have been a loyal Kodak user for over 10 yrs, but for this product to fail after light use in 14 months is not a reliable product.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: melissa "art enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my son. It takes a tiny micro memory card that is hard to get in and out of the camera and easy to loose. The worst is he had the camera 2 months when we couldn't get the camera battery to charge anymore. The camera comes with a charger that plugs into the camera so you don't take the battery out of the camera, when we plugged it in the camera blinked for hours. I finally took it off the charger and turned it on, it flashed "insufficient battery" and turned itself off.I took it to Cardinal Camera and the women took my battery and put it into another camera and it showed that it had charge and she took pictures with it, proving that it was not the battery but the camera. She also informed me that they do not carry Kodak cameras because they are not made by Kodak, they made by other company's and they slap their name on them so the quality is always questionable.I am in the process of getting everything all together to send it back to Kodak and am crossing my fingers!

Reviews.Title: poor quality hardware
Reviews.Author: Barbara Eddins
Reviews.Content: This camera sounds great, and it is until you use it the first or second time to transfer pics (or charge) and the usb port won't connect with the cord provided.  And, even worse, the Kodak website is horrible for trying to find information about any kind of repair. I lost my nikon coolpix, thought I'd try a Kodak.  Going back to Nikon or Canon.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera ever
Reviews.Author: Jay Mueller
Reviews.Content: Every thing the other negative reviews say is true: must charge through the camera, freezes up, extremely clunky touch screen (fumble, fumble s**t, fumble, fumble s**t trying to change the flash setting, fumble, fumble s**t, fumble, fumble s**t trying to revue the shots).  Plus: frequent blue bar that pops up saying "processing" when you're trying to shoot; sometimes when trying to charge the battery it drains instead; I've never owned a camera that won't lock focus and exposure while you re-frame your shot, until this one; I run it permanently on Kodachrome setting because the standard default makes people look like dead fish; sometimes you shoot but the camera doesn't.  This is absolutely the worst camera I've ever owned, I can't return it, if I can't sell it off, I'll toss it in the sea.

Reviews.Title: EasyShare and Touch
Reviews.Author: Swee2Swee
Reviews.Content: I received this camera timely as promised.  I had not alot of time with this camera to know all.  I must say, just to get started to take your pictures, it is hands down and the price were right also.  My camera arrived on time and were nicely packaged.  If you are looking for a camera with just the simple touch, well this is the camera, if you are looking for a camera that does it all, again this is the camera.  It has the one touch button to send to your social sites, like Facebook, emails, etc.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: gloria
Reviews.Content: It is very easy to use. Good quality of pictures. Sound is good on videos. I like the share button.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures but.....
Reviews.Author: Billy
Reviews.Content: This new camera from Kodak was well worth the money and takes great pictures.  The only cons I have for this camera are as follows:  1.  The on/off switch should not be right next to the shutter.  2.  When sharing a picture with someone's email it can be a hassle if you have a good number of email addresses programmed into the camera.  In other words, since it is a touch screen it is hard to stop at a specific person's email without inadvertently checking an email that is not wanted.  That will take practice for a person to get that down pat.  3. When looking at a picture that was taken, the screen goes into a sleep mode (gets a little darker) after a real short time and you have to touch the screen to get it brighter again.

Reviews.Title: Kodad M577
Reviews.Author: Yoslen A. Bolivar A "yoslenb"
Reviews.Content: excelente camara la compre hace mas de un mes y no he tenido ningun problema realice la compra desde venezuela excelente imagen y videoexcellent camera buy it over a month ago and have not had any problems buying from Venezuela make excellent image and video

Reviews.Title: horrible
Reviews.Author: J. Walker
Reviews.Content: the camera rarely works and is always freezing up. really upset as to what a waste of money this is, and the one touch sharing feature is a waste of time, wish i would have got the camera with wifi and not this piece of junk

Reviews.Title: what's going on with this camera?
Reviews.Author: M. Gasser
Reviews.Content: I kept this camera for a few weeks thinking that if I had time I would figure out how to use it.  And might find out how to make the touch screen work and why did it take pictures when I least expected it.  I had to purchase a pricey memory card which didn't fit in my new computer.  Well, I never did get anything but frustrated with it and I need it for my business, so back it went.  I then purchased a Casio EX-ZS10, recommended by CASIO to replace my EX-Z2000.  It has buttons and was up and running immediately.  Trash can and view photos buttons are right there where I expect them to be.  The battery was even charged!  And my old memory card fit.

Reviews.Title: Products Included
Reviews.Author: JackC
Reviews.Content: You should highlight that the ScanDisk Card needs to be purchased separately, or you cannot use the camera on arrival and charging.

ProductInfo.Features:
14 megapixels and 5X wide-angle optical zoom
3 in. touchscreen LCD features 2X more resolution than standard displays
One-button upload to e-mail, KODAK PULSE Display and other popular social networking sites
Li-Ion rechargeable battery and in-camera charging
64 MB internal memory[1]available, MICROSD/MICROSDHC card expansion slot
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak EasyShare Touch M577 14 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 3-Inch LCD Touchscreen - RedOrange
